question: The Gwalior-Chambal belt of Madhya Pradesh is to be converted into arable land with support from which international institution?
explanation:
The Agriculture Minister Narendra Singh Tomar announced that the Union Government is to collaborate with the World Bank, to convert the Gwalior-Chambal belt of Madhya Pradesh into arable land.
This has been decided in the virtual meeting with the World Bank representative. As per the statement, more than 3 lakh hectares of rugged land that remains not cultivable can be improved.  As a result, the regionâ€™s agricultural development, environmental protection and employment opportunities can be improved.
